verb.description: Strike repeatedly with hard blows; pound heavily and insistently.
examples: a prisoner was battered to death with a table leg

noun.description: A semiliquid mixture of flour, egg, and milk or water used in cooking, especially for making cakes or for coating food before frying.
examples: a batter thin enough to be poured

noun.description: A damaged area of metal type or a printing block.

origin: Mid 16th century (as a verb): of unknown origin.
